unit_learning_outcomes.description: Construct a plan for the improvement of an aspect of HRM or HRD practice justified by the literature and relevant to the context of a school/early childhood centre/workplace or educational organisation.
Deconstruct and critique a range of HRM and HRD policies and practices in education workplaces
Understand the scope of strategic Human Resource Management (HRM)  and Human Resource Development (HRD) practices in education contexts

enrolment_rules.description: Admission to MEd or GradCertEdS or MEdLead or MHEd or GradCertHEd or MEChild or GradCertEChild or MTeach(0-5) or GradCertClinEdSim or MIndigenousEd or GradDipIndigenousEd or GradDipChildLit or MChildLit

assessments.description: An individual essay of between 2500 and 3000 words with the focus determined in consultation with the unit convenor and developed within a required scaffold.
Two sets of individual papers of 1500 words each in response to stimulus questions.

data.subject_search_title: EDST8470 - Human Resource Management in Education
data.description: Strategic management of human resources is a key responsibility of leaders at all levels of educational organisations. Participants extend their understanding of the nature and inter-relationships of strategic human resource management and development functions (including recruitment, induction, continuing professional development, leadership development, performance management, succession planning and legislative compliance) and critically reflect on how these contribute to productive work environments, the formation of professional learning communities, and the attainment of organisational goals.
